questions.label: Regarding the Application named above - Which knowledge do you have?

options.label: Functional knowledge
Technical knowledge
Both

children.label: Business Fit:  Does the application's functionality fit the needs of the business?

options.label: 5 - (Best) Clearly meets all current requirements and business needs; easy to use
4 - (Above Average) Good fit and support of needs
3 - (Average) Acceptable, some misalignment or gaps which can be addressed
2 - (Below Average) Numerous capabilities missing
1 - (Worst) Poor alignment, significant deficiencies

children.label: Data:  Does the application meet information quality, availability, and privacy needs?

options.label: 5 - (Best) Primary source of record; data seamlessly/securely shared across organization
4 - (Above Average) Application is primary source of record; all policies easily enforced
3 - (Average) Trusted source of record with minimal additional data reconciliation
2 - (Below Average) One of multiple data sources or difficult to extract/leverage data
1 - (Worst) Difficult to reconcile data accuracy or enforce privacy/retention policy

children.label: Future Potential:  Can the application continue to support our evolving business needs?

options.label: 5 - (Best)  Strategic platform which clearly and easily supports 2-3 year business roadmap
4 - (Above Average) Strategic platform; configurable to support 2-3 year roadmap
3 - (Average) Can be adapted with reasonable level of effort
2 - (Below Average) Unsure or significant effort required to meet new business needs
1 - (Worst) New/future business needs cannot be met

children.label: Time to Market:  Can new functionality be deployed in a timely manner?

options.label: 5 - (Best) Fast provisioning of new functionality as part of normal operations
4 - (Above Average) Quick provisioning of new functionality with minimal overhead
3 - (Average) Regular, reliable provisioning of new functionality; meets expectations
2 - (Below Average)  New deployments are an "event"; some frustration with timeliness
1 - (Worst) General frustration; new functionality requires significant time and effort

children.label: User Satisfaction:  Are users of the application satisfied with it?

options.label: 5 - (Best)  Extremely satisfied with the solution
4 - (Above Average) Mostly satisfied with the solution
3 - (Average) Satisfied using the solution, but some room for improvement
2 - (Below Average) Mixed satisfaction with the solution
1 - (Worst) General dissatisfaction with the solution

children.label: Production Stability:  Is the application stable, reliable and performant?

options.label: 5 - (Best) No outages; great performance for all
4 - (Above Average) No unplanned outages; good performance for all
3 - (Average) Acceptable stability and reliability; acceptable performance for all
2 - (Below Average) Intermittent reliability problems OR some performance concerns
1 - (Worst) Major reliability problems with severe impacts; general performance issues

children.label: Maintainability:  Are we able to easily maintain and update the application and related interfaces?

options.label: 5 - (Best) Highly and easily configurable; can be maintained efficiently without risk
4 - (Above Average) Highly configurable; maintainability good, low risk and cost
3 - (Average) Average maintainability with no or minimal customizations (if purchased)
2 - (Below Average) Many customizations; significant effort to maintain with varying risk
1 - (Worst) Heavily customized; impact of changes difficult to predict

children.label: Resources:  Do we have the skills, expertise and/or vendor commitment needed to support the application?

options.label: 5 - (Best) Good pool of skilled staff and/or strong vendor commitment going forward
4 - (Above Average) Staff and/or vendor support sufficient, external supply for restaffing
3 - (Average) Staff and support adequate, restaffing not easy, unclear future
2 - (Below Average)  Staff inadequate, some missing skills; vendor hard to work with
1 - (Worst) Inadequate staff, missing skills, restaffing risk; vendor support will end

children.label: Cloud readiness:  Is the application able to leverage cloud technology to deliver scalability and continuity?

options.label: 5 - (Best) State-of-the-art, fully scalable, high availability and redundancy available
4 - (Above Average) Cloud enabled, non-functional requirements (SLAs) met
3 - (Average) Cloud ready, but not leveraging capabilities or cloud is not applicable
2 - (Below Average) Hosted on prem; shift to cloud would require effort
1 - (Worst) No clear path forward or cloud incompatible

children.label: Architecture Alignment:  Is application aligned to current architecture principles and Digital Backbone standards?

options.label: 5 - (Best) Fully aligned with Digital Backbone and current standards
4 - (Above Average) Mostly aligned, with an immediate action plan to resolve deviations
3 - (Average) Generally aligned with standards, acceptable deviations
2 - (Below Average) Noncompliant, unwanted technical debt exists
1 - (Worst) Noncompliant, no plan for eliminating technical debt

children.label: Security:  Are there known vulnerabilities or risks?

options.label: 5 - (Best) No vulnerabilities, risks or incidents; full tracing and auditing support in place
4 - (Above Average) No vulnerabilities or risks, able to detect and raise security incidents
3 - (Average) No known vulnerabilities; risks have been sufficiently mitigated
2 - (Below Average) Known security vulnerabilities, but clear plan to resolve quickly
1 - (Worst) Known security vulnerabilities with no plan to resolve quickly
